means: （使）提高( sharpen的过去式和过去分词 )
（使）变得更好（或技术更高、更有效等）

the hat curry has sharpened my appetite ., 咖喱的辣味刺激了我的胃口.
Lying hidden at her waist , was a sharpened dagger ., 腰间别了一把磨得飞快的匕首.

entry.tran: (感觉、理解)加强;(使)加深;(技巧)提高;(使)改善
entry.def: If your senses, understanding, or skills sharpen or are sharpened, you become better at noticing things, thinking, or doing something.

example.ex: Her gaze sharpened, as if she had seen something unusual...
example.tran: 她眼睛一亮，仿佛看见了什么不寻常的事情。

example.ex: You can sharpen your skills with rehearsal.
example.tran: 排练可以让技巧更加纯熟。

entry.def: If you sharpen an object, you make its edge very thin or you make its end pointed.

example.ex: He started to sharpen his knife.

entry.tran: (分歧、差异等)加剧;(使)加深;(使)加重
entry.def: If disagreements or differences between people sharpen, or if they are sharpened, they become bigger or more important.

example.ex: With urbanisation the antagonism between rich and poor sharpened...
example.tran: 伴随着城市化的推进，贫富间的对立情绪也加剧了。

example.ex: The case of Harris has sharpened the debate over capital punishment.
example.tran: 哈里斯案激化了人们对死刑的争论。

auth_sentence.content: Do I hear the sound of knives being sharpened?

auth_sentence.content: Virtually overnight, the tone of the page sharpened.

auth_sentence.content: But this year, I've not sharpened even one.
